title: Expand certification content library to exhaustive coverage and strengthen AI professor persona

requirements.text: Expand the certification content data in `frontend/src/data/certifications.ts` to be fully exhaustive for all 8 CompTIA certifications (A+, Security+, Network+, Linux+, Cloud+, CySA+, PenTest+, CASP+). Every certification entry must include: all official exam domains and sub-domains, every exam objective and sub-objective as listed in the official CompTIA exam objectives documents, all relevant port numbers and their associated protocols/services, all CLI commands and tools students must know, all key protocols (OSI layer, function, exam context), all acronyms and their full definitions, all key concepts and technologies per domain, common exam scenario tips, and memory aids or mnemonics where applicable. The content must be thorough enough that a student using only this app can pass the real exam.

quotes: it needs to be as complete as possible
a one stop web site that anyone can use to pass any comptia exam that we have listed
i need the AI to understand its the professor and that it needs to instruct the person asking with ALL information avalible for the ceritification test

acceptanceCriteria: Each of the 8 certifications (A+, Security+, Network+, Linux+, Cloud+, CySA+, PenTest+, CASP+) has a complete list of all official exam domains and sub-domains matching CompTIA's published exam objectives
Every domain entry includes all sub-objectives, key terms, acronyms, and relevant exam tips

Port numbers data includes all ports commonly tested for that certification (e.g., 20/21 FTP, 22 SSH, 23 Telnet, 25 SMTP, 53 DNS, 80 HTTP, 110 POP3, 143 IMAP, 443 HTTPS, 3389 RDP, and all others relevant per cert)
Commands and tools section is populated for every applicable domain with syntax notes and use-case context
Protocols section covers OSI model context, function, and exam-specific details
Acronyms list is exhaustive per certification with full expansions and brief definitions
No placeholder or stub entries remain — all fields are populated with real content

requirements.text: Update the AI instructor system prompt and response logic in `frontend/src/pages/StudyMode.tsx` (and anywhere else AI prompts are constructed, such as QAPractice and Flashcards) to explicitly establish the AI as an authoritative CompTIA professor. The system prompt must: (1) instruct the AI that its role is an expert CompTIA professor and exam instructor, (2) direct it to proactively teach ALL content for the selected domain/certification — not merely answer questions but deliver structured, comprehensive instruction as a professor would in a classroom, (3) require it to cite specific exam objectives, port numbers, commands, acronyms, protocols, and tools when relevant, (4) require it to provide exam tips, common pitfalls, and memory aids, (5) instruct it to use all available certification data as its knowledge base, and (6) instruct it to ensure the student is exam-ready by the end of any study session.

quotes: i need the AI to understand its the professor
it needs to instruct the person asking with ALL information avalible for the ceritification test

acceptanceCriteria: The AI system/context prompt in StudyMode explicitly states the professor role and instructs comprehensive teaching, not just Q&A answering
AI responses in Study Mode include structured explanations referencing exam objectives, ports, commands, acronyms, and protocols from the certification data
AI responses include exam tips and common pitfalls where relevant
QAPractice explanations for correct/incorrect answers are detailed and reference official exam objective context
Flashcard back-of-card explanations reference the specific domain objective and provide exam context
The AI prompt in PracticeTest review phase instructs comprehensive explanations tied to exam objectives

requirements.text: Audit and complete the backend data model in `backend/main.mo` to ensure it can store and retrieve the full expanded certification content (domains, sub-domains, objectives, key terms, ports, commands, protocols, acronyms, exam tips) as structured records. Ensure the backend can persist question attempts, flashcard decks, and test results with all required fields, and that any missing storage functions (add, get, update, delete) are implemented for all data types.

quotes: a one stop web site that anyone can use to pass any comptia exam that we have listed

acceptanceCriteria: Backend actor exposes functions to store and retrieve question attempts keyed by certification and domain
Backend actor exposes functions to store and retrieve flashcard decks keyed by certification
Backend actor exposes functions to store and retrieve test results with per-question breakdown
All data types are stable and upgradeable (use stable variables or stable memory patterns)
No missing or stub functions for any of the documented data operations

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui
All Motoko logic must remain in the single backend/main.mo actor file
Certification content must reflect actual CompTIA official exam objectives — do not fabricate or approximate domain names or objective numbers
nonGoals: Adding new certifications beyond the 8 already listed (A+, Security+, Network+, Linux+, Cloud+, CySA+, PenTest+, CASP+)
Changing the visual theme or layout
Adding new pages or navigation routes
Integrating external APIs or live CompTIA data feeds
